item.title: Daily Fortune
item.description:
Todays fortune was so funny i needed to blog it;

WARNING!!!
This machine is subject to breakdowns during periods of critical need.

A special circuit in the machine called "critical detector" senses the
operator's emotional state in terms of how desperate he/she is to use the
machine.  The "critical detector" then creates a malfunction proportional
to the desperation of the operator.  Threatening the machine with violence
only aggravates the situation.  Likewise, attempts to use another machine
may cause it to malfunction.  They belong to the same union.  Keep cool
and say nice things to the machine.  Nothing else seems to work.

See also: flog(1), tm(1)

Sabrina (my girlfriend) yesterday hammered on her PS3 while it was firmware upgrading..

item.title: docker.io/sspreitzer/shellinabox:2.19
item.description:
Relevant links first

  • github.com/sspreitzer/docker-shellinabox
  • hub.docker.com/r/sspreitzer/shellinabox

Work

A new version and automatic build of docker.io/sspreitzer/shellinabox has been created. Reason was a major rework to safe space (~10MB) and version update.

  • ubuntu xenial based
  • shellinabox 2.19 with a lot of customization possibilities

Rants

It was a three hours fight to find out that I was unable to solve the riddle of how to properly escape GNU bash variables in the exec shell builtin. The workaround was to create symlinks to the respective whitespaces files which included dashes instead of whitespaces.

item.title: cloudfuse Fedora 22 x86_64 rpm
item.description:
I was packaging cloudfuse for Fedora to access my OpenStack Swift object storage.

  • Github project
  • RPMs

item.title: Git Basics Presentation
item.description: Here is my first presentation about Git which I also use for trainings

item.title: Hello World! (again)
item.description: It has been a while since spreitzer.ch has seen an update. In the last days I had some time containerizing my two vServers and the outcome is also a brand new spreitzer.ch website. The design might give a forecast on what is yet to happen in a few months. Stay tuned..
